message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CC 

The paper presents a novel method for constructing longer LDPC codes from shorter ones, which is a topic related to information theory (cs.IT). The method involves decomposing the parity-check matrix of a shorter code into non-overlapping components and combining them according to a Latin square, which involves some combinatorial and graph-theoretic concepts (cs.DS, cs.CC). The resulting longer codes can be used for communication purposes, which is a topic related to networking and communication (cs.NI). The paper also discusses the performance of the constructed codes, which can be evaluated using simulation and statistical analysis (cs.SI).
